p: The human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) is a species of Lentivirus belonging to the family of Retroviridae and is the primary infectious agent that is responsible for causing acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS) [ 12, 13]. The major modes of transmission of HIV include unprotected heterosexual intercourse, men who have sex with men, intravenous/injection drug use, and mother-to-child transmission, with certain methods being main contributions to regional epidemics [ 14].
